HalfdanQuestions.question: Young Halfdan listened to tales of his famous father who was renowned for his valor and wit. Who was this legendary figure?
Fueled by vengeance for their father's death, Halfdan and his brothers assemble a formidable force. What is this army famously known as?
Halfdan's journey took him to the heart of England, where he and one of his brothers laid siege to a major city. Which brother stood by his side?
After many conquests, Halfdan's path led him to a significant seat of power. Which city did he rule?
The Raven Banner: In battle, Halfdan and his brothers were often recognised by a particular standard, symbolising their lineage and might. What was it?
Revenge Served Cold: Halfdan's thirst for vengeance was rooted in the belief that a particular English King was responsible for his father's death. Who was this King?
Halfdan's journey was not without challenges. At one pivotal battle, he faced the combined forces of Wessex and Mercia. Which battle was it?
Throughout his life, Halfdan held many titles, but there's one he never claimed. Which one?
Halfdan's life was full of battles and conquests, but his demise is shrouded in mystery. How do some tales suggest he met his end?
options: Lost in a storm at sea
Assassinated in the alleys of Dublin
HalfdanQuestions.answer: Lost in a storm at sea

HalfdanQuestions.question: Despite the passing of time, Halfdan's legacy remains, echoed in tales and songs. What is he NOT remembered for?

LeifEriksonQuestions.question: Who was Leif Erikson's famous father?
What is the modern-day name of the region Leif likely explored?
Which among the following was NOT one of the names Leif gave to the newly discovered places?
Apart from being an explorer, what was Leif's significant mission when he returned to Greenland?
options: To convert the Norse to Christianity
To claim lands for the Norwegian king
To find a passage to Asia
LeifEriksonQuestions.answer: To convert the Norse to Christianity

LeifEriksonQuestions.question: What is the modern-day country where Leif Erikson's settlements were likely located?
On his travels, Leif once found a man adrift at sea and rescued him. What precious object did this man possess?
When the Norse settlers encountered indigenous people, by what name did the sagas refer to these native inhabitants?
Which other member of Leif's family attempted to establish a more permanent settlement in the lands Leif explored?
Although Leif Erikson made incredible voyages, who is often more credited with 'discovering' America?
When is Leif Erikson Day celebrated in the United States?

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: You are Henry VIII, how many wives did you have during your lifetime?
What is the correct order of your wives?
options: Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Parr, Catherine Howard
Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, Catherine Parr
Catherine of Aragon, Anne of Cleves, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Catherine Parr, Catherine Howard
Catherine Howard, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine of Aragon, Catherine Parr
HenryVIIIQuestions.answer: Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, Catherine Parr

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: You are married to Catherine of Aragon, and want to leave her, what do you do?
options: Have the Catholic Church allow you to divorce her
Have the Protestant Church allow you to divorce her
Create the Church of England to divorce her
HenryVIIIQuestions.answer: Create the Church of England to divorce her

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: You are married to Anne Boleyn and have found out she just cheated on you, what do you do?
You're married to Jane Seymor, she gives you what you've always wanted. What is this?
What is the correct order of your wives' cause of death?
options: Divorced, beheaded survived, divorced, beheaded, died
Beheaded, divorced, died, beheaded, divorced, died
Beheaded, divorced, died, beheaded, divorced, survived
Divorced, beheaded, died, divorced, beheaded, survived
HenryVIIIQuestions.answer: Divorced, beheaded, died, divorced, beheaded, survived

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: What happened when you first met Anne of Cleves?
options: You found out she had an affair

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: Catherine Howard was related to one of your previous wives, who was she related to?
What happened when you married Catherine Parr?
options: You died in a jousting competition in January 1547
You died from an infected wound in January 1547
HenryVIIIQuestions.answer: You died from an infected wound in January 1547

HenryVIIIQuestions.question: Who did you wish to be buried beside?
Who were your children?
options: Edward VI, Mary I, Elizabeth I
Mary I, Edward VII, Elizabeth I
Mary I, Edward VII, Elizabeth I, Charles II
HenryVIIIQuestions.answer: Edward VI, Mary I, Elizabeth I

PopeQuestions.question: Who was head of the English Church before the Reformation?
Henry VIII has asked for an annulment. Who does he wish to annul with?
Who did you send over to hear about Henry's wish to annul?
What reasons did you not approve of the annulment? (select all that apply)?
options: Catherine had a powerful Catholic family who would have dissaproved
You would have to go against the exemption of the previous Pope which allowed Henry and Catherine to marry
Henry’s argument for having sinned by marrying his brother’s widow was in fact false. He did what was right at the time.

PopeQuestions.question: Who essentially held you prisoner?
options: Catherine of Aragon’s cousin, Charles V
Anne of Cleves’s father, John III
Catherine of Aragon’s brother, Prince of Asturias
PopeQuestions.answer: Catherine of Aragon’s cousin, Charles V

PopeQuestions.question: In what year did Henry VIII create the Church of England?
What religion did the Church of England follow?
Who supported Henry VIII to carry out the Dissolution of the Monasteries?
Who in Henry’s inner circle disapproved of the Church of England?
Which of Henry’s children was the most devout Protestant?
Which of these Tudor monarchs restored the English Church to Catholisim?

NapoleonQuestions.question: Which battle was not fought by you?
You were defeated in which battle?
On what island did Napoleon Bonaparte die?
When did Napoleon become the emperor of France?
Why didn't Napoleon attack England?
options: They had an alliance with England.
They had the biggest navy in the world.
NapoleonQuestions.answer: They had the biggest navy in the world.

NapoleonQuestions.question: What was Napoleon's most glorified battle?
What did Napoleon do to confirm his title as Ruler of France?
After the fall of Napoleon, what was the name of the meeting place where the alliance of the government divided the empire?

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: At what age did Joan of Arc start to have visions?
What did Joan of Arc do as a child?
options: Went to school and learnt how to read and write.
Went to church every single day with her family.
Took care of the animals on her parents' farm and was an excellent seamstress.
JoanaofArcQuestions.answer: Took care of the animals on her parents' farm and was an excellent seamstress.

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: What year did Joan of Arc become a saint?
Why did the English men dislike Joan of Arc?
options: They were intimidated by her because she was an excellent fighter.
She didn't play fair and made the soldiers go easy on her.
She wasn't a true leader in their eyes.
JoanaofArcQuestions.answer: She wasn't a true leader in their eyes.

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: How is Joan of Arc similar to Ellie from Tomorrow When the War Began?
options: They were both brought up on a farm. This naturally gave them skills and strengths that helped them in war.
They were both leaders of a group and brought them to victory.
They are both young leaders, at the age of 16.

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: What is Joan known for?
options: Joan is known for dressing up as a man at war, so the men didn't mistreat her.
Joan is known for saving her country from being taken over by the English, that had been going on for nearly a hundred years and they had no chance of winning.
Joan is known for being one of the youngest military leaders ever.

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: What did Joan's visions from Michael the archangel tell her to do?
options: To leave her family and go get an education.
To kill two of the animals on her farm and feed it to the poor.
To bring the French to victory against the English.
To join the English troops and lead them to victory against the French.
JoanaofArcQuestions.answer: To bring the French to victory against the English.

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: What did Joan teach us about leadership?
options: That the key is to blackmail and manipulate.
Put others before yourself, be persuasive, be determined
JoanaofArcQuestions.answer: Put others before yourself, be persuasive, be determined

JoanaofArcQuestions.question: Is Joan of Arc's nickname 'The Maid of Orleans'?

Joan of Arc at the age of eighteen was captured, sold to the English, didn't find her guilty except that she dressed as a man, which was enough for her to be worthy of death and this resulted in her being burnt alive.

JuliusCaeser.question: Julius Caesar had what kind of family background?
You married your wife Cornelia in 84 B.C.E., and a few years later you were asked to do what?
Your elected career started in 72 B.C.E., when you were elected what?
After Cornelia died in 69 B.C.E., you married a relative of what famous Roman?
How many times did you marry?
Where was your first big takeover?
Your most famous quote 'Veni, vidi, vici' ('I came, I saw, I conquered') was said on August 1st 47 BC following which battle?
options: The battle of Pharsalus (ending the Civil War against the Republicans)
The defeat of Ptolemy in Alexandria
The defeat of Pharnaces at Zela
JuliusCaeser.answer: The defeat of Pharnaces at Zela

JuliusCaeser.question: Who was your principal enemy in the Civil War?
While being dictator of Rome, you were offered a crown by Marc Antony according to the historian Plutarch, to declare him King of Rome. But you refused. What is a possible reason you refused?
options: A dictator had more power than a king.
He desired to be king of the whole empire.
Marc Antony was his enemy, so this act was suspicious.
It was a theater for the people.
JuliusCaeser.answer: It was a theater for the people.

JuliusCaeser.question: You were assassinated on the Ides of March 44 BCE at a meeting of the Roman senate, by who?
options: Brutus and a group of political opponents
Cleopatra and a group of political opponents
JuliusCaeser.answer: Brutus and a group of political opponents

AugustusEmperor.question: You, Emperor Augustus also known as Octavian, a youth of 19 years, was the heir of Julius Caesar, who bequeathed him a fortune. Mark Antony withheld the money to thwart your efforts to build a political base. How did you execute the financial features of Caesar's will?
options: You went on a military campaign for war spoils.
Another relative willed more money to you.
You borrowed the money to execute Caesar's will.
AugustusEmperor.answer: You borrowed the money to execute Caesar's will.

AugustusEmperor.question: When you defeated Antony and Cleopatra, what plans did you have for Cleopatra?
options: You considered appointing her governor of Egypt.
You planned to exile her to the Egyptian wilderness.
You intended to execute her in Alexandria.
You wanted to lead her into Rome in chains behind his chariot.
AugustusEmperor.answer: You intended to execute her in Alexandria.

AugustusEmperor.question: What happened to the Roman economy when you returned to Rome with Egyptian wealth?
options: There was panic in Rome and banks closed.
Interest rates fell and money came out of hiding.
AugustusEmperor.answer: Interest rates fell and money came out of hiding.

AugustusEmperor.question: What power granted to you by the Senate gave you authority outside of Italy?
You returned to Rome from Egypt with many legions under your control, including those which defected from Mark Antony. What did you do with regard to this huge army?
options: You camped all of them outside of Rome.
You disbanded many legions and settled their veterans in colonies.
You gave control of them totally to the Senate.
You left a large force in Egypt.
AugustusEmperor.answer: You disbanded many legions and settled their veterans in colonies.

AugustusEmperor.question: With which wife did you have one natural child?
When you returned victorious to Rome after defeating Antony and Cleopatra, approximately how many legions were under your command?
The Ludi Saeculares (Secular Games) were revived by you in what year?
There was objection to Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa marrying Julia, your daughter. Why was this?
options: He was not of noble birth.
He had been a previous enemy of yours.
He grew up with Mark Antony.
AugustusEmperor.answer: He had been a previous enemy of yours.

AugustusEmperor.question: You fell ill while away from Rome and died. Where did you pass away?

Tutankhamun.question: In which year is Tutankhamun thought to have been born?
During which period of Egyptian history did Tutankhamun live?
What informal name is given to the figure identified as Tutankhamun's mother?
What name is given to the pharaoh, believed to be Tutankhamun's father, who revolutionized Egypt's traditional religious system?
To which site did Akhenaten move Egypt's capital in 1343 BC?
Which British aristocrat was the financial backer of the successful search for Tutankhamun's tomb?
Although we now know him as Tutankhamun, this was not his original name. What was it?
The discovery of Tutankhamun’s tomb is one of the 20th century’s most famous events. But what claim to fame does the tomb itself have within the Valley of the Kings?
options: It’s the most ornate tomb in the Valley of the Kings
More archaeologists have died inside it than any other tomb
It’s the smallest tomb in the Valley of the Kings
It’s carved with more spells and curses than any other pharaoh’s tomb
Tutankhamun.answer: It’s the smallest tomb in the Valley of the Kings

Tutankhamun.question: Where was Tutankhamun buried?
options: In the Temple of Abu Simbel

Tutankhamun.question: Who succeeded him as Pharaoh after his death?

Cleopatra.question: In what year was Cleopatra born?
How many brothers and how many sisters did Cleopatra have?

Berenice IV and Cleopatra VI, Cleopatra's older sisters, overthrew their father, Ptolemy XII, in order to rule by themselves. Cleopatra VI vanished strangely one day and not long after Ptolemy XII took back his throne with the aid of the Romans. What punishment did he give to Berenice IV?
options: She was sent to live with a peasant family
She was barred from the throne
She was executed in front of her father
Cleopatra.answer: She was executed in front of her father

Cleopatra.question: Shortly after Cleopatra had ascended to the throne there was an attempted coup. Her co-ruler Ptolemy XIII and her younger sister Arsinoe raised the Egyptian Army against her in a plot to remove her from power. Which Roman general helped Cleopatra to win back her throne?
How many children did Queen Cleopatra VII have altogether by her two lovers Julius Caesar and Marc Antony?
What happened to Cleopatra's younger sister Arsinoe after she was caught when escaping from the Alexandrian War?
options: She was taken back to Rome and led in a trail of conquest through the streets
She was brought back for a last meeting with her sister Cleopatra and then executed by armed guards.
Cleopatra.answer: She was brought back for a last meeting with her sister Cleopatra and then executed by armed guards.

Cleopatra.question: After Caesar's death in 44 BC, the Roman Empire was split between Marc Antony and Octavian. Marc Antony and Cleopatra became very close while he was governing in the east. What did Octavian have to say about this?
options: That Antony was one of the luckiest men in the world to be with the Egyptian Queen
That Antony had brought new and useful information to Rome about Egypt
That Antony no longer cared at all about Rome but only about the Egyptian Queen
That Antony had disgraced the Egyptian Queen
Cleopatra.answer: That Antony had disgraced the Egyptian Queen

Cleopatra.question: In the 30s BC Octavian declared war on Marc Antony. Antony moved to the cove of Actium to prepare all his resources for battle. Many Roman soldiers at Actium with Antony disliked Cleopatra's presence. Why?
options: They thought she would hinder their movements
They thought she might try to seize command
They feared she would distract Antony
They felt a woman didn't belong on a battlefield
Cleopatra.answer: They thought she might try to seize command

Cleopatra.question: What happened at the Battle of Actium in 31 BC?
options: Antony drowned, whereupon the Egyptian ships fled
Cleopatra and Antony's navy was almost completely obliterated and Cleopatra had to flee back to Egypt with Antony lagging behind
Cleopatra.answer: Cleopatra and Antony's navy was almost completely obliterated and Cleopatra had to flee back to Egypt with Antony lagging behind

Cleopatra.question: When the Roman army approached Alexandria, Cleopatra locked herself and her two female servants Charmian and Iras, into her mausoleum. Roman soldiers climbed in through a window and pulled Cleopatra out and she was then locked up in her room. She used the pretense of preparing Antony's body for the afterlife in her tomb to go back inside her tomb. What fate befell Queen Cleopatra?
options: Roman soldiers yet again climbed in through an open window and pulled her back to Octavian
Cleopatra, dressed in all her finery, killed herself using an asp
She used a concoction of poison that she had prepared for such a time
She prepared Antony for the afterlife and returned to Octavian for her journey back to Rome.
Cleopatra.answer: Cleopatra, dressed in all her finery, killed herself using an asp
